abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey satisfactory project
            outcomes, and a likely sustainability, in spite of
            negligible institutional development impacts. Implementation
            of the programs supported by the project, has been uneven:
            while progress has been achieved in improving macroeconomic
            stability, implementation of structural reforms was slower
            than expected; in areas such as public expenditure
            management, divestiture of state owned assets, energy and
            public sector, reforms proved difficult, especially given
            the international market conditions making the sale of
            enterprises impossible, or the domestic coalition in support
            of reforms, weakened. The recent experience points to three
            main lessons. First, Government commitment to reform is
            critical if policy actions are to be sustained. Recent
            reforms - such as the preparation of the Ghana Poverty
            Reduction Strategy - show that significant progress can be
            achieved, provided the authorities take the lead, and adopt
            a communication strategy in implementing the policy agenda.
            Second, the development of "ownership" may take
            longer than expected when a new Government comes to power,
            and a time-consuming consensus building needs to be attained
            to gain support of the civil society. Accordingly, Bank
            adjustment operations need to pro-actively, identify the
            potential for electoral-induced policy lapses; incorporate
            measures responsive to slippages, should these occur; and,
            ensure ownership of reforms by government, and civil society
            to improve the likelihood of policy implementation.
            Likewise, careful consideration needs to given as to what
            constitutes policy conditionality, as submission of
            legislation to Parliament does not necessarily translate
            into policy implementation. Third, selectivity, and realism
            are essential when the reform agenda is vast, and available
            capacity might be less strong than desirable. Overall,
            shortcomings of the traditional adjustment lending point to
            a different institutional environment, such as the one
            provided by programmatic lending under the envisaged series
            of Poverty Reduction Strategy Credits.
